title: Patchwork Mod Mk-II
content:
LL: Ah, at last its done.

BD: Yes, after weeks of tireless beta testing and colating.

LL: Now to upload-

KeenRush: Wait! Wait! I have a another level to add!

LL: Run! *flees*

KR: Oh no you don't *Chases, tackles BD, much blood and gore, throws level at LL, direct hit.*


[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/snap0002.png[/img]

Yes, its finally here, the mod you've all been waiting for, sent stuff in for, forgotten about and bought the T-shirt, The 2nd Patchwork mod!

Get it here: http://levellord.toxicsheep.com/Patchwork%20MkII.zip
This mod has been triply beta tested, to the highest standards 2 teenage girls and a German guy could manage, so I'm pretty sure there's nothing there that will ruin your modding experience. [Although with KeenRush's levels the line between 'impossible' and 'KeenRussian' was very thin, I hope you realize I had to fight off a rabid beta tester from altering BOTH your levels KR.]

This time around I got a lot more levels than last time, so many I had to make 5 'extra' levels on a special section of map. Tiles came in pretty thickly after the origional trickle, as well as story ideas and art. No one added any patches though, so I had to be inventive.

As a bonus, try and guess which ONE level was constructed by me. [There are, I estimate, about 3 'impossible' levels in the mod, none is mine and none is vital, but if you finnish them, you're better than me.]A proud member of the signature stealing society


[img]http://cheston.com/pbf/PBF042BCPyroBilly.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here.
" -Level Lord

This mod tastes like moldy cheese! I love it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I've played couple of levels now.. This mod is so cool.. Well, back to playin'. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Patchwork Mod Mk-II
content:
Pretty cool! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

But it looks like you left the Keen 2 exe in it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pirate.gif[/img]


Heehee... cheese [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: Patchwork Mod Mk-II
content:
I haven't yet finished every level: I have watched BTTF 3 and done some other stuff.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] But I've completed a lot over half, though.

My second level for that mod, the level I made yesterday, isn't possible in this mod. Since I of course hadn't any Patchwork 2 graphics and such, and of course couldn't know the sizes of enemy (and Keen) replacements, "they" have needed to alter my levels a bit. Well, there were some jumps that were hard but now you don't (too bad) need to do them. The levels were originally a bit harder. My second level, however, isn't possible to get through in this mod. Every single place in that level is, except this place:
[img]http://keengrid.net/keenrush/fix.gif[/img]
In original Keen 2 (where I made the level) you can jump over two tiles in that kind of place. But in this mod Keen is taller and you can't do the jump. "They" didn't notice to fix this. Therefore, if they are going to fix it, I suggest them to move the yellow platform one tile right (where the green arrow points in the picture).

EDIT: DON'T READ THE STUFF ABOVE! YOU CAN ACTUALLY GO THROUGH THAT TWO TILE JUMP, ALL YOU NEED IS A DIFFICULT, RIGHTLY TIMED POGO JUMP! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

In that picture, you can as well see where the levels made by me are.. Why? Well, just for fun. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Patchwork Mod Mk-II
content: Ooooooh, tricky. Certainly bordering on KeenRussian there.

title: Re: Patchwork Mod Mk-II
content:
Hehe.

Anyways, I just completed every level on this mod. Gotta say, this mod was really cool, much better than the first Patchwork mod. Good job everyone!

Oh, and I rather not take a cheese burger for a while! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] [/lame joke]You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: whee!
content:
This is awesome--the level length is trim and short, which I love.

I got tripped up on the 2nd 'haystack' looking level, the one directly to the right of the first. The platforms over the flaming pipes were pretty ambiguous--I didn't feel like I was jumping on anything secure the whole time... died a lot there. And then, when I thought I'd finally beat the level, I pogo'ed on top of the exit door and GOT STUCK. >:-(

This is awesome and fun so far, though.

title: Re: whee!
content:
"The platforms over the flaming pipes were pretty ambiguous--I didn't feel like I was jumping on anything secure the whole time... died a lot there."
Yeah, that was really annoying part..

The levels I didn't like were the ones that had cheese all over, where you had to go inside the cheese all the time and you couldn't see Keen much. There were two that kind of levels.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Cool!
content: Well, that was awesome!  Challenging in all the right places, too.  I agree with KR that the all-cheese levels were a bit annoying.  CheesyDave's gonna be bummed... he was working hard on the CheesyMod on his laptop, and it got erased... and then this Cheese-related mod comes out.  :-)  I'll break it to him gently.

title: Re: Cool!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]EDIT: DON'T READ THE STUFF ABOVE! YOU CAN ACTUALLY GO THROUGH THAT TWO TILE JUMP, ALL YOU NEED IS A DIFFICULT, RIGHTLY TIMED POGO JUMP![hr][/quote]

I wrestled with this. As usual BD said 'oh no, change it, Keens taller, it'll be too difficult' and I said 'Nah, KR would love this little trick, it suits him right to the ground' I won.

And as for the exit door[s] BD said 'should we fix that' and I said 'nah. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img] ]A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: hehe
content:
Yeah, see, here's what happened: CheesyDave was very excited because he was going to get a brand new laptop as part of his advancement at the university he was attending--he didn't need his old laptop any more. So he offered to sell it to me for really cheap because I didn't have a laptop, and I figured if I had a laptop, I'd get to work on KeenModdin' at work. So I bought the laptop from him, reformatted the hard-drive, spent 2 weeks trying to get the right drivers to make everything work right, gave up, and trashed the stupid thing. Then CheesyDave says, "Dude, my CheesyMod was on that laptop!" ... We both forgot. :-(

LevelLord, what did you base the look of "Xky Tower" on? I recognized the stopwatch from my Keen3 mod, and the towers themselves looked sorta like the blue buildings on my map screen in my Keen1 mod... I'm just curious.
